trans-unit.source: Provides information about a cache entry that was removed from the cache.

The properties of <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments> class represent the cache entry itself, the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache> instance that the entry was removed from, and the reason for the removal.
The constructor of the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments> class uses these arguments to create a new instance of the class.

A <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments> object is typically created in a callback method to pass information about a removed cache entry back to an application when a cache entry is removed from the cache.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments"></xref> class.
Developers typically use the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments> class when they want to be notified after a cache entry has been removed from the cache.

When a cache implementation is about to remove one or more cache entries from the cache, the cache implementation calls the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedCallback> delegate that was registered in the application.

When a cache implementation calls the delegate, it typically calls the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments.%23ctor%2A> constructor to pass to the callback a new <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments> instance that contains information about the cache entry that is being removed.
The callback notifies the application that registered the callback about the cache entry that is being removed.
After the constructor returns, the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments> instance contains the details about the removal of the cache entry.
The instance from which cacheItem was removed.
One of the enumeration values that indicate why cacheItem was removed.
An instance of the cached entry that was removed.
source is `null`.
-or-
cacheItem is `null`.
Gets an instance of a cache entry that was removed from the cache.
An instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem"></xref> class that was removed from the cache.
Gets a value that indicates why a cache entry was removed.
The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason> enumeration indicates one of a predefined set of reasons for the removal, such as that the entry was explicitly removed or that it expired.
One of the enumeration values that indicates why the entry was removed.
Gets a reference to the source <xref href="System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache"></xref> instance that originally contained the removed cache entry.
A reference to the cache that originally contained the removed cache entry.
